definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms

sentences.english: The midsole supplies a shoe's cushioning.
sentences.chinese: 鞋中间层提供了鞋的缓冲。

sentences.english: Core data structure processing routine subsystem is the middle layer of this project.
sentences.chinese: 核心数据及其处理例程子系统是本项目的中间层。

sentences.english: The next layer in the atmosphere is thethermosphere named for its high temperature.
sentences.chinese: 中间层顶后是热成层，它是因为这里的高温而得名的。

sentences.english: It allows the encapsulation of database functions from the rest of the mid-tier logic.
sentences.chinese: 它将数据库功能与其他中间层逻辑隔离开。

sentences.english: Next is the mid level, also called the common or unifying layer.
sentences.chinese: 接下来的是中间层，也称为公共层或统一层。

sentences.english: The supplement of water in intermediate layer of bipolar membrane is an extremely important.
sentences.chinese: 双极膜中间层水的补充问题对双极膜的性能至关重要。

sentences.english: The mid floor has an open layout with literally no doors and a good visual connection between spaces.
sentences.chinese: 中间层由于没有门而拥有良好的空间视觉效果。

sentences.english: The midsole is the section that lies between the shoe bottom and the insole.
sentences.chinese: 鞋中间层是介于鞋底和鞋垫之间的那一部分。

definition: ground or first floor/bottom (of a pile)/lowest rung (of society)
